oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CHEMICAL VARIATIONS IN THE TERTIARY CARBONATES OF SOUTHWESTERN KUTCH, GUJARAT - A STATISTICAL APPROACH
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMAR, A
RATHA, DS
NANDY, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: carbonates
sedimentology
statistical geology
kutch
gujarat
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tertiary carbonates from Kutch have been analysed for chemical constituents such as Ca, Mg, Mn, Fe, Sr, Ba and insoluble residue. Vertical distribution of these elements shows a gradual decrease is Ca and Sr and increase in Mn, Fe, Ba and insoluble residue from older to younger beds. R-mode factor analysis of chemical data is interpreted. The first factor loaded on IR- Mn-Fe-Ba is considered to be the effect of elastic deposition, chemical co-precipitation and adsorption by clay minerals. The second factor loaded on Ca, Sr, Ba and Mg explains their syndeposition, leading to the formation of limestones.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE GEOLOGICAL SOCIETY OF INDIA, 46(3), 295-301
